intro: Pimpinella ramosissima, commonly known as the branched cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Pimpinella ramosissima is often found in disturbed soils and can be a common weed in certain regions.
